title: Labor MP says 'significant anxiety' surrounds new autism service
text: A Labor MP puts his party on notice after a hearing into the proposed 'Thriving Kids' autism service delivers little detail, warning that the lack of information is causing families "significant anxiety".

title: Rock fisher swept off rocks by giant wave 'extremely lucky' to be alive
text: Quick-thinking locals leapt into action after a tourist in WA's north was swept into the ocean while rock fishing.

title: Is Israel breaking the law by stopping the Gaza-bound flotilla?
text: According to a UN legal framework, a nation's territory does not extend beyond 19km from its shores but enforcing international maritime law is a challenge across the globe.

title: Demons happy for Oliver to 'explore his options' in AFL Trade Period
text: Clayton Oliver appears set to leave Melbourne after the Demons reveal they will not stand in his way if he wants to consider a trade to another club.

title: Emergency operation underway after bodies found near Falls Creek
text: Police are responding after reports of two bodies that were found in a remote Victorian alpine region.

title: Reserve Bank signals cautious approach to rate cuts
text: The RBA indicates it will consider easing if inflation keeps cooling, but remains data-dependent.

title: Global markets steady as investors digest earnings
text: Stocks were mostly flat with mixed corporate results across sectors.

title: $12 billion Snowy 2.0 project faces further cost blowouts
text: Snowy Hydro says it will need to acquire more funds to deliver the Snowy 2.0 renewable energy project, as costs continue to spiral beyond the previous $10 billion blowout.

title: 'Too much': Hunter Valley bus crash driver appeals 32-year sentence
text: Lawyers for the driver of a bus that crashed in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, killing 10 people, have detailed his appeal against a 32-year sentence.

title: Murder accused Beau Lamarre-Condon makes courtroom outburst
text: Former NSW Police officer Beau Lamarre-Condon tells a Supreme Court judge that he "will not be silenced" and declared "the truth will prevail".

title: What we know about the Manchester synagogue terror attack
text: A witness says the attacker crashed his car and then began "stabbing anyone near him" before trying to get into the synagogue.

title: Accused author of unauthorised pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender identified
text: The Australian Electoral Commission has launched legal action against a finance executive and Wentworth constituent in relation to 47,000 unauthorised pamphlets which were distributed in the electorate during the 2025 election campaign.

title: Film festival opens with acclaimed indie drama
text: The opening night drew large crowds as critics praised the director's latest work.
